substitution.copyText: ''When he lay couched in the' ominous horse, | '' Hath now his dread and black complexion smear'd | '' With Heraldry more dismal head to foot: | '' Now is he total Gules, horridly trickt | '' With blood of fathers, mothers, daughters, sons, | '' Bak'd and embasred with parching streets, | '' That lend a tyrannous and a damned light | '' To their Lords murder, roasted in wrath and fire, | '' And thus o re-ciseed with coagulate gore, | '' With eyes like Carbuncles, the hellish Pyrrus | '' Old grandfire Priam seeks; so proceed you.
